node.title: NATO offers Ukraine new military help, assigns more troops to eastern flank
node.description: NATO, which has already beefed up its eastern flank to 40,000 troops spread from the Baltic to the Black Sea, agreed to set up new combat units in Bulgaria, Romania, Hungary and Slovakia.

node.title: Ministers told to be 'cautious' about subsidising green hydrogen production
node.description: The environment watchdog is calling for the country to take stock of its whole energy set-up before charging down a path to green hydrogen.

node.title: Measuring and reporting Covid-19 deaths: What you need to know
node.description: With so many Covid-19 deaths being recorded, how are they measured and reported? And how will the coming weeks look in terms of reported deaths? RNZ is here to clear it all up.

node.title: Australia refugee deal signed off one month ago - minister
node.description: Immigration Minister Kris Faafoi says Australia rekindled New Zealand's offer to take some refugees being housed in detention camps in 2020 and Cabinet signed off on the plan a month ago.

node.title: North Korea fires 'long-range' ballistic missile
node.description: North Korea fired a suspected long range ballistic missile toward the sea off its east coast on Thursday, militaries in South Korea and Japan said.

node.title: Nebraska congressman Jeff Fortenberry found guilty in campaign probe
node.description: The trial could all but end the political career of a congressman seen as a reliable conservative.

node.title: Watch: Traffic lights change may be regional, PM says
node.description: Shifting from red to orange in the traffic light system could be done regionally, depending largely on hospitalisations, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has confirmed.

node.title: 'Tourism can no longer be built on the back of cheap labour' - Minister
node.description: The Tourism Minister says the industry needed to strive towards a regenerative industry and that also meant improving staffing practices as well as the environment.

node.title: Women indecently assaulted in Christchurch red zone
node.description: Police are warning Christchurch residents to take caution after receiving several reports of a young man indecently assaulting women.

node.title: F1 set to make Las Vegas Moto-Vegas
node.description: Forty years after last hosting a Formula 1 race, Las Vegas is to return to the F1 schedule.

node.title: Queues form for Costco membership, months before opening
node.description: Customers have been queuing to get their hands on a coveted Costco membership months before the country's first store officially opens.

node.title: Oklahoma teens' car made "rolling stop" before crash that killed 6, NTSB says
node.description: Six teenage girls were killed in the two-vehicle crash on Tuesday.

node.title: Call for govt to subsidise sustainable aviation fuel
node.description: A trans-Tasman alliance is calling on the government to partner with the private sector to accelerate the use of biofuels by the aviation sector.

node.title: Information about black Suzuki Swift sought in relation to Raglan homicide
node.description: Police are seeking information about the movements of black Suzuki Swift in relation the death of a man in Raglan in January.

node.title: University staff face redundancies as fewer students enrol
node.description: Universities are facing their toughest year of the pandemic yet as domestic and foreign student numbers slump.

node.title: Red Bull needs points in round two of F1
node.description: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen goes into this weekend's Saudi Arabian Grand Prix keen to get over Red Bull's "double-DNF" hangover.

node.title: More communities connecting since Covid-19 pandemic hit
node.description: An increased interest in connecting with neighbours has continued two years on from the first lockdown.

node.title: 'Politically convenient': Refugees policy changing because voters find it abhorrent - Amnesty
node.description: The Australian government has agreed to New Zealand's refugee resettlement offer purely because it is politically expedient, Amnesty says. Audio

node.title: Teachers speak out against Florida school legislation
node.description: Some of America's most highly regarded teachers are speaking out against a Florida proposal and others like it around the country.

node.title: Govt sets out plan to lift children's maths, literacy performance
node.description: The government promising more support for teachers and a new system of tests to measure children's abilities.

node.title: East Coast flooding: Road repairs focus on cut-off communities
node.description: With rain still falling in the Gisborne area after severe flooding, roading contractors are trying to repair routes to areas where residents are cut off, and detours round closed highway. Audio

node.title: Second grand jury declines to charge Deshaun Watson
node.description: Watson, who has denied all illegal conduct, still faces civil lawsuits.

node.title: U.N. votes for humanitarian access to Ukraine, demands Russian hostilities end
node.description: The General Assembly voted to demand an immediate end to attacks by Russia and create humanitarian access in Ukraine.

node.title: Hefty fines for shareholders after market manipulation, disclosure breaches
node.description: The High Court has handed out hefty fines to two shareholders in Oceania Natural after they admitted to charges of market manipulation and disclosure breaches.

node.title: Ginni Thomas and Mark Meadows texted about overturning 2020 election
node.description: CBS News and The Washington Post have obtained copies of numerous text messages exchanged between Thomas and Trump's White House chief.

node.title: TairƒÅwhiti flood damage 'will take about a year' to clean up
node.description: Tokomaru students had been back in flood-repaired classrooms for just weeks, while two residents lost a campervan they were living in while their house was fixed after last year's floods.

node.title: NZME exploring content deal with Google News
node.description: Media company NZME is looking to cut a deal with technology heavyweight Google about supplying news.

node.title: Authorities poised to act as severe weather travels down North Island
node.description: The East Coast of the North Island is assessing the damage left by severe weather overnight with even more downpours yet to come. Audio

node.title: DHBs contracting former employees 'shocking waste of taxpayers' money'
node.description: Questions are being raised whether hospitals are accurately reporting their massive spending on often highly paid contractors.

node.title: Chinese authorities may already be examining black box recorder
node.description: The Chinese agency responsible for aviation announced one of the black boxes from the flight is already en route to Beijing for analysis.
